close due to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/4044

I take a look at this problem today. This was due to the topological sort issue of LSTM. Traditionally, the topological order of backward pass is always the reverse order of the forward pass. This means the forward traditionally goes from left to right, down to up, and the backward goes in the reverse direction.  

In the NNVM pass, there is no strict order of backward pass, which goes by PostOrderDFS, with the gradient out and the softmax as head.
So what happened is follow

The current graph have
```
Embedding -> SliceChannel
                          -> t0_i2h -> t0 LSTM
                                         |
                             t1_i2h -> t1 LSTM
```
In the gradient calculation pass, we do postDFS for embedding_weight_grad, which requires SliceChannel grad, and requires t0_i2h_backward and t1_i2h_backward.
Note that because there is no dependency between t0_i2h and t1_i2h, they can be ordered arbitrarily, and in this case, they are ordered to be t0, t1, while the
ideal case should have been t1 t0.

To fix this case, we will be adding a control flow dependency in the sum aggregation nodes, when there is no existing order between them, to ensure that the order is enforced.

```python

net = mx.sym.Variable('v1')
fc1 = mx.sym.FullyConnected(data=net, name='fc1', num_hidden=10)
act1 = mx.sym.Activation(data=fc1, name='act1', act_type='relu')
fc2 = mx.sym.FullyConnected(data=act1, name='fc2', num_hidden=3)
soft2 = mx.sym.SoftmaxOutput(data=fc2, name='soft2')

ctx = mx.gpu(1)
batch_size = 128
data_shape = (batch_size, 256)
executor = soft2.simple_bind(ctx=ctx, grad_req='write', v1=data_shape)
```
because you set `data` in simple_bind, but in your symbol, no `data` there, but only `v1`, so you should use ```v1=data_shape```, then will be ok.

Looks like cudnn path issue.
Try following steps:
Change to cudnn root folder and type:
    sudo mv include/cudnn.h /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/include/
    sudo mv lib/libcudnn* /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib
    sudo ln -s /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib/libcudnn* /usr/local/cuda/lib/

Then changed to mxnet root folder and type:
    cp make/osx.mk ./config.mk
    echo "USE_CUDA=1" >>config.mk
    echo "USE_CUDA_PATH=/usr/local/cuda" >>config.mk
    echo "USE_CUDNN=1" >>config.mk
    echo "USE_DIST_KVSTORE=1" >>config.mk
    make clean
    make -j$(sysctl -n hw.ncpu)

this is because when  ```kvstore is not None``` in ```_update_params()``` , which means ```kvstore='local'``` and the model parameters is too big to push, then it will update the model in the local device, ref. https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/python/mxnet/model.py#L63-L69, so at this time, push and pull on kvstore is equivalence to ```updater(index*num_device+k, g, w)``` i think.

```
 if len(sys.argv) < 4:
@@ -87,7 +88,7 @@ def expand(x, pending):
         h = m.groups()[0].strip('./')
         source = find_source(h, x)
         if not source:
-            if h not in blacklist and h not in sysheaders: sysheaders.append(h)
+            if h not in blacklist and h not in sysheaders and 'mkl' not in h and 'nnpack' not in h: sysheaders.append(h)
         else:
             expand(source, pending + [x])
     print >>out, "//===== EXPANDED: %s =====\n" %x

```

If parameter size is smaller than `MXNET_KVSTORE_BIGARRAY_BOUND`, it will send to one of the servers according to a hash function, otherwise parameter will be divided averagely into all servers. see code here
https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/src/kvstore/kvstore_dist.h#273
